qas.question: When did the party's performance tank in local elections?
Where did Labour fail to gain ground?
What did the Conservative party gain in Wales?
Where did the Conservatives enjoy a +3.26 swing?
Who won the London mayor election?

context: The party's performance held up in local elections in <b0_0>2012<b0_0/> with Labour consolidating its position in the North and Midlands, while also regaining some ground in <b1_0>Southern England<b1_0/>. In Wales the party enjoyed good successes, regaining <b2_0>control of most Welsh Councils<b2_0/> lost in 2008, including the capital city, Cardiff. In Scotland, Labour's held overall control of Glasgow City Council despite some predictions to the contrary, and also enjoyed a +3.26 swing across <b3_0>Scotland<b3_0/>. In London, results were mixed for the party; <b4_0>Ken Livingstone<b4_0/> lost the election for Mayor of London, but the party gained its highest ever representation in the Greater London Authority in the concurrent assembly election.
